perturbation.original_text: Hereafter referred to as the “Company” or “AZUL”,
perturbation.changed_text: Hereafter referred to as the “Company” or “Client”,
perturbation.explanation: The term 'AZUL' is replaced with 'Client,' creating ambiguity. Later sections might refer to responsibilities of 'AZUL' and introduce confusion as to whether these responsibilities extend to the 'Client'.

perturbation.original_text: Hereafter referred to as the “Repairer’ or “ATR”,
perturbation.changed_text: Hereafter referred to as the “Repairer’ or “Service Provider”,
perturbation.explanation: The term 'ATR' is replaced with 'Service Provider'. In subsequent clauses, obligations tied to 'ATR' may become unclear if they also apply to the broader definition of 'Service Provider'.

perturbation.original_text:
The Repairer, its Affiliates and/or its Subcontractors as applicable shall remain the exclusive owner of any intellectual property right related to
the Services including: design of the LRUs, Main Elements, job cards, task cards, operating manual or industrial process, as relevant. No title
to or other ownership interest in
perturbation.changed_text:
The Repairer, its Partners and/or its Vendors as applicable shall remain the exclusive owner of any intellectual property right related to
the Services including: design of the LRUs, Main Elements, job cards, task cards, operating manual or industrial process, as relevant. No title
to or other ownership interest in
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Affiliates' and 'Subcontractors' are replaced with 'Partners' and 'Vendors' respectively. This creates uncertainty about the scope of intellectual property ownership and whether it extends to entities beyond traditional affiliates and subcontractors.
